intro: Nastus tsaratananensis, commonly known as the Madagascar moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, night-blooming flowers. The plant produces large, white, star-shaped flowers that open at night and close during the day. It is a climbing shrub with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. Nastus tsaratananensis is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated for its unique blooming pattern.
